item.title:
RT by @ForoysktDaily: Against all odds
#FaroeIslands (population 55.000) has beaten many giants on the path to our first-ever European Handball Championships. The #EHFEURO2024 is in Berlin. Over 5K or 10% of our population has gone to #Berlin to support the team

item.title:

item.title:
#Streymnes (pop. 320), located in #Saksunardalur by the river #St√≥r√°, was first mentioned in 1584. Its name comes from words #streym (stream) and #nes (headland).
The #FaroeIslands first #whaling station was built at nearby #Gj√°noyri in 1893.

item.title:
#Sy√∞radalur (pop. 6) on #Kalsoy was founded by inhabitants of #Blankask√°li. They decided to move after the #avalanche devastated their homes in 1809.
#Blankask√°li, now abandoned, is believed to be the oldest settlement on #Kalsoy.

item.title:

item.title:
#Sandav√°gur (pop. 985) enjoys the view of all the southern islands in the #FaroeIslands.
Its name comes from #Faroese words #sanda (sand) and #v√°gur (small bay) and refers to sandy beach which used to be much bigger.

item.title:
#Lopra (pop. 87) lies on #Su√∞uroy and may date back to a pre-#Norse settlement of Gaelic #hermits from around 6-8th century AD.
Its name may also have the #gaelic origin - the word #lobar which translates into #leprosy.
#FaroeseCities #FaroeIslands

item.title:
#S√∏rv√°gur (pop. 1152) lies on the island of #V√°gar. Its name can be of #OldNorse origin - coming either from words #seyr (sand) or #saurr (mud, dirt).
The place can also be named after #S√∏rli - the first man who is believed to settle here.

item.title:
#G√°sadalur (pop. 13) is situated in a deep valley (#dalur)

#g√°sa is also a #Faroese word for a goose

item.title:
#Mykines (pop. 15) is the only settlement on the westernmost #Faroese island. It‚Äôs the only place where the¬†#gannet nests.
The peculiar name of the island likely has #Gaelic roots. It originates from the #Celtic words *Muc-innis meaning pig-island.
#FaroeseCities #f√∏royskt

item.title: R to @ForoysktDaily: #V√≠karbyrgi was heavily hit by the #BlackDeath in 1349 - only one woman, called #Sneppan survived the plague. The long isolation meant that she did not want to have contact with others. She did not die of hunger, thanks to men from #Sumba who hoisted dried meat down to her.
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description: #V√≠karbyrgi was heavily hit by the #BlackDeath in 1349 - only one woman, called #Sneppan survived the plague. The long isolation meant that she did not want to have contact with others. She did not die of hunger, thanks to men from #Sumba who hoisted dried meat down to her.

item.title:
#V√≠karbyrgi (now #abandoned) was in the #MiddleAges one of the largest settlements on #Su√∞uroy. It is considered one of the oldest settlements in the #FaroeIslands.
Its name comes from the #Faroese words #v√≠k - bay and #byrgi - enclosed place / animal shelter.
#FaroeseCities

item.title:
#Morskranes (pop. 15) lies on the west coast of #Eysturoy.
Its name - according to Eivind #Weyhe - may come from strongly inflected form of the #Faroese noun¬†#skurur - young bird of lesser black-backed #gull (#LarusFuscus).
#FaroeseCities #FaroeIslands #f√∏royskt #fauna

item.title:
R to @ForoysktDaily: The #Sk√¶lingsfjall mountain was long thought to be the #FaroeIslands highest.
The original name of the mountain used to be #Sk√¶lingur. Later on it got the #fjall suffix (mountain) to tell it apart from the village.
item.dc:creator: @ForoysktDaily
item.description:
The #Sk√¶lingsfjall mountain was long thought to be the #FaroeIslands highest.

The original name of the mountain used to be #Sk√¶lingur. Later on it got the #fjall suffix (mountain) to tell it apart from the village.
